English: Princess Alexandrina Victoria of House Hanover has ascended to the throne of The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland as 'Queen Victoria'. Today a jubilant London crowd has escorted her to her residence in the newly built Buckingham Palace. People of all classes and creeds are delighted to see the new Monarch take her place as sovereign of the UK, and the Queen herself is reportedly looking forward to the tasks and challenges which accompany this onerous office. Her uncle, King William IV, will be greatly missed and fondly remembered by the British people.
German: Prinzessin Alexandrina Victoria von Hannover hat den Thron des Vereinigten Königreichs von Großbritannien und Irland als 'Königin Victoria' bestiegen. Die jubelnde Londoner Menge eskortierte sie zu ihrer Residenz im neuen Buckingham Palace. Menschen aller Klassen und jeden Glaubens freuen sich über die neue Monarchin auf dem Thron Großbritanniens und die Königin sieht lt. Berichten den Aufgaben und Herausforderungen dieses ehrbaren Amtes freudig entgegen. Ihr Vater, König George III. wird sehr vermisst werden und dem britischen Volk in guter Erinnerung bleiben.
Spanish: La Princesa Alexandrina Victoria de la Casa Hanover ha ascendido al trono del Reino Unido de Gran Bretaña e Irlanda como 'Reina Victoria'. Hoy, una jubilosa multitud londinense la ha acompañado a su residencia en el recién construido Palacio de Buckingham. Personas de todas las clases y credos están encantadas de ver a la nueva Monarca ocupar su lugar como soberana del Reino Unido y, según se informa, la propia Reina espera con ansias las tareas y los desafíos que acompañan a este oneroso cargo. Su tío, el rey Guillermo IV, será extrañado y recordado con cariño por el pueblo británico.

English: Louis Riel Gains Public Notice

The noted Louis Riel has become a figurehead amongst his people. He calls for increased rights for Metis people across Canada. Unique among his number, the young Riel has quickly risen to prominence due to his eloquent speech, his education, and his earnest beliefs. Leaving him alive would be a great example of Canada's freedom of speech, but the government can pull a few strings in order to effect a policy beneficial to the status quo.
Spanish: El célebre Louis Riel se ha convertido en una figura decorativa entre su gente. Pide mayores derechos para los mestizos en todo Canadá. Único entre su grupo, el joven Riel ha saltado rápidamente a la fama debido a su discurso elocuente, su educación y sus creencias sinceras. Dejarlo con vida sería un gran ejemplo de la libertad de expresión de Canadá, pero el gobierno puede mover algunos hilos para llevar a cabo una política beneficiosa para el status quo.

William McDougall

The Anglo-Canadian gentleman William McDougall has been proposed to be the Lieutenant Governor of the troubled Rupert's Land/North West Territories. His invaluable service and experience in the past puts him in a prime position to manage the territories, but some believe his anti-French and Anti-Metis policies to be too heavy-handed for the troubled territories.

Su invaluable servicio y experiencia en el pasado lo colocan en una posición privilegiada para administrar los territorios, pero algunos creen que sus políticas anti-francesas y anti-Metis son demasiado estrictas para los territorios en conflicto.

English: The Red River Rebellion

The Red River Rebellion, later referred to as the First Riel Rebellion, was a rebellion that occurred soon after Canadian Confederation. The Canadian Government had installed an anti-French and anti-Metis lieutenant governor, William McDougall, in the newly-bought North West Territory. When McDougall sent surveyors into what would eventually be the province of Manitoba, the restless Metis inhabitants sent their own delegation to intercept these surveyors and proclaimed the existence of the Metis Confederation. Historically, they established a provisional government in the new Confederation, which the Canadian Government tolerated while the situation developed.
Spanish: La Rebelión de Red River, más tarde conocida como la Primera Rebelión de Riel, fue una rebelión que ocurrió poco después de la Confederación Canadiense. El gobierno canadiense había instalado a un vicegobernador anti-francés y anti-Metis, William McDougall, en el Territorio del Noroeste recién comprado. Cuando McDougall envió topógrafos a lo que eventualmente sería la provincia de Manitoba, los inquietos habitantes de Metis enviaron su propia delegación para interceptar a estos topógrafos y proclamaron la existencia de la Confederación Metis. Históricamente, establecieron un gobierno provisional en la nueva Confederación, que el gobierno canadiense toleró mientras se desarrollaba la situación.

English: Let the situation develop.
Spanish: Dejemos que la situación se desarrolle.

English: Acknowledge their sovereignty.
The Execution of Thomas Scott

Thomas Scott, an Orangeman of Irish descent, was executed by Louis Riel during the Red River Rebellion for conspiring against the self-proclaimed Metis provisional government. Historically, Riel wished to show the world that the Metis peoples were demanding to be taken seriously, but the Canadian Government viewed this action by Riel as a step too far and outfitted the Wolseley Expedition to quell the Rebellion. After conflicts with the Metis, Louis Riel was captured and exiled to the United States. With this, the Red River Rebellion was crushed, but the Metis and Native peoples would not soon forget this act.
Spanish: Thomas Scott, un hombre de Orange de ascendencia irlandesa, fue ejecutado por Louis Riel durante la Rebelión de Red River por conspirar contra el autoproclamado gobierno provisional de Metis. Históricamente, Riel deseaba mostrarle al mundo que los pueblos métis exigían que se los tomara en serio, pero el gobierno canadiense vio esta acción de Riel como un paso demasiado lejos y equipó a la Expedición Wolseley para sofocar la Rebelión. Después de conflictos con Metis, Louis Riel fue capturado y exiliado a los Estados Unidos. Con esto, la Rebelión del Río Rojo fue aplastada, pero los Metis y los pueblos nativos no olvidarían pronto este acto.

English: Our hands are tied. Outfit the expedition!
Spanish: Tenemos las manos atadas. Enviad apoyo a la expedición!

English: The Return of Louis Riel and the Second Riel Rebellion
Spanish: El regreso de Louis Riel y la Segunda Rebelión de Riel

English: After being elected to parliament three times in absentia after his exile, Louis Riel returned to Canada in 1884. Using increased Metis and Native cohesion, the ailing Riel managed to assemble a loose coalition to reattempt his rebellion for Metis independence in 1885. Historically, this rebellion was a failure due to internal strife amongst Rebellion leaders, an increasingly ill and megalomaniacal Riel, and increased Federal cohesion. Canada was no longer a fledgling nation just getting on its feet, and quickly moved to wipe out Riel and his rebellion.
Spanish: Después de ser elegido para el parlamento tres veces en ausencia después de su exilio, Louis Riel regresó a Canadá en 1884. Utilizando una mayor cohesión entre los mestizos y los nativos, el enfermo Riel logró reunir una coalición flexible para volver a intentar su rebelión por la independencia de Metis en 1885. Históricamente, este La rebelión fue un fracaso debido a las luchas internas entre los líderes de la Rebelión, un Riel cada vez más enfermo y megalómano y una mayor cohesión federal. Canadá ya no era una nación incipiente que solo se estaba poniendo de pie, y rápidamente se movió para acabar con Riel y su rebelión.

English: We have no time for this. Let them be independent.
Spanish: No tenemos tiempo para esto. Déjenlos ser independientes.

English: A United Canada is best for all.
Spanish: Una Canadá unida es lo mejor para todos.

English: The Metis have gone too far and must know their place.
Spanish: Los Métis han ido demasiado lejos y deben conocer su destino.

English: Louis Riel's Fate

Historically, after surrendering to the Canadian forces after his failed rebellion, the Canadian Government held a quick trial in what can be best called a kangaroo court. Held in a hostile city before a jury of purely Anglo-Canadian Protestant jurors, the Catholic Metis Louis Riel was found guilty of treason and sentenced to death after a trial lasting only five days. Louis Riel refused to plea insanity, instead delivering two heartfelt speeches to the court, and later asserting to his lawyer that "Life, without the dignity of an intelligent being, is not worth having." Louis Riel was hanged on the 18th of September, 1885. His rebellions and the spirit of the Metis would largely die with him, but in due time he would be remembered as a folk hero amongst White, Metis, and Native people alike.
Spanish: Históricamente, después de rendirse a las fuerzas canadienses después de su rebelión fallida, el gobierno canadiense llevó a cabo un juicio rápido en lo que mejor se puede llamar un tribunal canguro. Celebrado en una ciudad hostil ante un jurado de jurados protestantes puramente anglocanadienses, el católico Metis Louis Riel fue declarado culpable de traición y condenado a muerte tras un juicio que duró sólo cinco días. Louis Riel se negó a declararse loco, en cambio, pronunció dos discursos sinceros ante el tribunal y luego le afirmó a su abogado que "la vida, sin la dignidad de un ser inteligente, no vale la pena". Louis Riel fue ahorcado el 18 de septiembre de 1885. Sus rebeliones y el espíritu de los Metis morirían en gran medida con él, pero a su debido tiempo sería recordado como un héroe popular entre los blancos, los mestizos y los nativos por igual.

English: Remerciez, Madame Forget.
He is old and infirm. Let him die in peace.
Spanish: Es un anciano debilucho. Dejadlo morir en paz.

Although they promise to bring the nation to a new era of equality and prosperity for all, their inflammatory rhetoric and alleged deeds is seen by some as an affront to individualism and humanity itself. English: The Republican Coup

The end of slavery had resulted in an explicit shift of support to republicanism by rich and powerful coffee farmers who held great political, economic and social power in the country. To avert a republican backlash, the government adopted a series of credit and military policies and reforms to appease the land owners. The measures made by the government alarmed the civilian republicans and the Positivists in the military corps. They saw that it would undercut support for their own aims, and were emboldened to further action. For them, it had become a case of "now or never". Although there was no desire in Brazil among the majority of the population to change the form of government, the civilian republicans began pressuring the Positivist officers to overthrow the monarchy. The Positivists launched a coup d'etat and tried to institute a republic on November 15, 1889. During the whole ordeal Pedro II showed no emotion, as if unconcerned about the outcome. He only commented:
Spanish: El fin de la esclavitud había provocado un cambio explícito de apoyo al republicanismo por parte de los ricos y poderosos cafeteros que tenían un gran poder político, económico y social en el país. Para evitar una reacción republicana, el gobierno adoptó una serie de políticas y reformas crediticias y militares para apaciguar a los terratenientes. Las medidas adoptadas por el gobierno alarmaron a los republicanos civiles y a los positivistas del cuerpo militar. Vieron que eso restaba apoyo a sus propios objetivos y se envalentonaron para seguir actuando. Para ellos, se había convertido en un caso de "ahora o nunca". Aunque la mayoría de la población brasileña no deseaba cambiar la forma de gobierno, los civiles republicanos comenzaron a presionar a los oficiales positivistas para que derrocaran la monarquía. Los Positivistas dieron un golpe de estado e intentaron instaurar una república el 15 de noviembre de 1889. Durante toda la prueba, Pedro II no mostró ninguna emoción, como si no le preocupara el resultado. Sólo comentó:

English: If this is how it is, I will retire.
Crush the rebellion!
The Golden Law

The Lei Áurea (Golden Law) was sanctioned by Isabel, Imperial Princess of Brazil, who was regent at the time while her father, Emperor Dom Pedro II, was in Europe. It was signed on May 13, 1888 and was the law that abolished slavery in Brazil. It had only two articles. The succinctness of the law was intended to make clear that there were no conditions of any kind to the freeing of all slaves. Aside from the activities of abolitionists, there were a number of reasons for the signing of the law: slavery was no longer profitable, as the wages of European immigrants, whose working conditions were poor, cost less than the upkeep of slaves, and the decline in the arrival of new slaves – Brazil was the last country in the Western world to abolish slavery. The Brazilian government was also under pressure from Britain, who sought to end the slave trade in order to expand production in its own colonies.
Spanish: La Ley Áurea fue sancionada por Isabel, princesa imperial de Brasil, que era regente en ese momento mientras su padre, el emperador Dom Pedro II, estaba en Europa. Se firmó el 13 de mayo de 1888 y fue la ley que abolió la esclavitud en Brasil. Sólo tenía dos artículos. La concisión de la ley pretendía dejar claro que no había condiciones de ningún tipo para la liberación de todos los esclavos. Aparte de las actividades de los abolicionistas, hubo varias razones para la firma de la ley: la esclavitud ya no era rentable, ya que los salarios de los inmigrantes europeos, cuyas condiciones de trabajo eran malas, costaban menos que el mantenimiento de los esclavos, y la disminución de la llegada de nuevos esclavos - Brasil fue el último país del mundo occidental en abolir la esclavitud. El gobierno brasileño también estaba bajo la presión de Gran Bretaña, que pretendía acabar con la trata de esclavos para ampliar la producción en sus propias colonias.

English: From this date, slavery is declared abolished in Brazil.
Spanish: Desde hoy, la esclavitud no tiene más lugar en Brasil.

English: Free slaves? Revoke this useless law!
The Rise of Getulio Vargas

Vargas was born in the state of Rio Grande do Sul, into a family prominent in state politics. By 1922 he had risen rapidly in state politics and was elected to the National Congress, in which he served for four years. In 1926 Vargas became minister of finance in the Cabinet of President Washington Luís Pereira de Sousa, a post he retained until his election as governor of Rio Grande do Sul in 1928. From his position as state governor, Vargas campaigned unsuccessfully as reform candidate for the presidency of Brazil in 1930. While appearing to accept defeat, Vargas in October of that year led the revolution, organized by his friends, that overthrew the oligarchical republic. For the next 15 years Vargas assumed largely dictatorial powers, ruling most of that time without a congress. He held sole power as provisional president from Nov. 3, 1930, until July 17, 1934, when he was elected president by the constituent assembly.
Spanish: Vargas nació en el estado de Rio Grande del Sur, en el seno de una familia destacada en la política estatal. En 1922 había ascendido rápidamente en la política estatal y fue elegido para el Congreso Nacional, en el que estuvo cuatro años. En 1926, Vargas se convirtió en ministro de Hacienda del Gabinete del Presidente Washington Luís Pereira de Sousa, cargo que conservó hasta su elección como gobernador de Rio Grande do Sul en 1928. Desde su puesto de gobernador estatal, Vargas hizo campaña sin éxito como candidato reformista a la presidencia de Brasil en 1930. Aunque parecía aceptar la derrota, en octubre de ese año Vargas encabezó la revolución, organizada por sus amigos, que derrocó a la república oligárquica. Durante los 15 años siguientes, Vargas asumió en gran medida poderes dictatoriales, gobernando la mayor parte de ese tiempo sin un congreso. Ejerció el poder en solitario como presidente provisional desde el 3 de noviembre de 1930 hasta el 17 de julio de 1934, cuando fue elegido presidente por la asamblea constituyente.

English: Today you are with the government. Tomorrow you will be the government.
Spanish: Hoy estás con el gobierno. Mañana lo serás.

English: The Fascist Movement Arises

A group of far-right extremists has begun to organize within the country, and their pamphlets have recently become a thorn in our regime's side. Their views are on the fringe, and their methods of spreading their views have been clandestine so far. They preach order, unity, strength, homogenous cultures, and national exceptionalism, and while this may please the common man, they are still a potential threat to our regime.
Spanish: Un grupo de extremistas de extrema derecha ha comenzado a organizarse en el país, y sus panfletos se han convertido recientemente en una espina para nuestro régimen. Sus puntos de vista son marginales, y sus métodos de difusión han sido hasta ahora clandestinos. Predican el orden, la unidad, la fuerza, las culturas homogéneas y el excepcionalismo nacional, y aunque esto puede gustarle al hombre común, siguen siendo una amenaza potencial para nuestro régimen.

English: Keep an eye on them. Do you have the latest stock ticker?
Spanish: Mantened un ojo sobre ellos. ¿Tenéis el último tablero de cotizaciones?

English: The Fascists Go Openly Public

Thanks to increased awareness of the fascist platform amongst our people, the fascist organizations within our nation have begun to go public in their demonstrations. They have begun to stalk the streets, intimidating others, and have attacked their communist ideological enemies. This roughhousing may or may not be good for the nation, but we can't explicitly support one side or the other without changing our regime or committing political suicide.
Spanish: Gracias a la mayor conciencia de la plataforma fascista en nuestro pueblo, las organizaciones fascistas dentro de nuestra nación han comenzado a hacer públicas sus manifestaciones. Han comenzado a acechar las calles, intimidando a otros, y han atacado a sus enemigos ideológicos comunistas. Este enfrentamiento puede ser bueno o no para la nación, pero no podemos apoyar explícitamente a uno u otro bando sin cambiar nuestro régimen o cometer un suicidio político.

English: Let the fascists play at politics a while.
Spanish: Dejemos a los fascistas jugar a ser políticos por un tiempo.

English: We must keep order in the streets!
Spanish: Debemos mantener el orden en las calles!

English: Fascist Rallies!

The local fascist organizations have largely united and created a series of awareness-raising and strength-flaunting rallies. These rallies have the amazing ability to inspire people and convert them to the fascist cause, and even have the potential to influence our very government. The communist and liberal groups within our nation have been pestering us to make a decision about these extremists, and this is surely a defining moment in our nation's politics.
Spanish: Las organizaciones fascistas locales se han unido en gran medida y han creado una serie de reuniones de concientización y de demostración de fuerza. Estos mitines tienen la asombrosa capacidad de inspirar a la gente y convertirla a la causa fascista, e incluso tienen el potencial de influir en nuestro propio gobierno. Los grupos comunistas y liberales de nuestra nación nos han estado molestando para que tomemos una decisión sobre estos extremistas, y este es seguramente un momento decisivo en la política de nuestra nación.

English: I have to admit that their slogans are appealing.
Spanish: Debo admitir que sus lemas son atractivos.

English: This has gone on for far too long. This must end.
Greater Denmark rises!

Given our glorious status in the world, nationalists within our country have taken it upon themselves to encourage a rebirth of our ancestral Viking roots. While this has great traction amongst the already nationalistic, government intervention could give this movement the push needed to become a truly national movement. This will, of course, worry the rest of the world, but what are they compared to the glory and might of our nation?
Spanish: Dado nuestro glorioso estatus en el mundo, los nacionalistas dentro de nuestro país se han encargado de fomentar un renacimiento de nuestras ancestrales raíces vikingas. Aunque esto tiene una gran tracción entre los ya nacionalistas, la intervención del gobierno podría dar a este movimiento el empuje necesario para convertirse en un movimiento verdaderamente nacional. Esto, por supuesto, preocupará al resto del mundo, pero ¿qué son ellos comparados con la gloria y el poder de nuestra nación?

English: FOR DENMARK!
What? No.
Lucky Nations

Sometimes in this world, nations seem to be blessed by God in certain periods. Their leaders are brilliant, their people are hardy, they excel in warfare, produce amazing works of culture, and their economies boom. Do we live in such a world? If Lucky Nations are turned on, ten random westernized nations who are not Great Powers and five random non-western nations will be given special bonuses that will enable them to shake up the status quo of the world by giving them significant bonuses.
Spanish: A veces, en este mundo, las naciones parecen ser bendecidas por Dios en ciertos períodos. Sus líderes son brillantes, su pueblo es resistente, sobresalen en la guerra, producen obras culturales asombrosas y sus economías están en auge. ¿Vivimos en un mundo así? Si se activan las Naciones Afortunadas, diez naciones occidentales al azar que no sean Grandes Potencias y cinco naciones no occidentales al azar recibirán bonificaciones especiales que les permitirán sacudir el status quo del mundo otorgándoles importantes bonificaciones.

English: Turn Lucky Nations On.
Keep Lucky Nations Off.
Moving the Capital

In 1840 Said bin Sultan, Sultan of Muscat and Oman moved his capital from the Omani city of Muscat to the economic heart of his empire, the African island of Zanzibar in a successful attempt to increase the amount of products he could export from the region.
Spanish: En 1840, Said bin Sultan, sultán de Mascate y Omán, trasladó su capital de la ciudad omaní de Mascate al corazón económico de su imperio, la isla africana de Zanzíbar, en un intento exitoso de aumentar la cantidad de productos que podía exportar desde la región.

English: Setting the Borders of Italy
With our Union of Italy at hand, how should we draw the border between Austria and Italy?
Spanish: Con la unificación de Italia a nuestro alcance, debemos decidir cómo será la frontera entre Austria e Italia.

English: Petition Austria for Savoie?
We have been notified of Austria's intent to unify the Italian peninsula. Should we ask them to cede control of Savoie, which possesses as sizable French population?
Spanish: Hemos sido notificados de la intención de Austria de unificar la península italiana. ¿Debemos pedirles que cedan el control de Saboya, que posee una considerable población francesa?

English: French Claims in Italy
France has expressed interest in our union of Italy. They ask for us to return to them Savoie, which has a sizable French population.
Spanish: Francia ha expresado su interés en nuestra unificación de Italia. Piden que les devolvamos Saboya, que tiene una considerable población francesa.

English: French Claims in Italy

France has expressed interest in our union of Italy. They ask for us to return to them Savoie, which has a sizable French population. In addition, they also demand Piemonte. If we accede to both of these demands our union of Italy will surely been seen as flimsy excuse to divide Italy between us.
Spanish: Francia ha expresado su interés en nuestra unificación de Italia. Piden que les devolvamos Savoie, que tiene una considerable población francesa. Además, exigen la cesión de Piamonte. Si accedemos a estas dos demandas, nuestra unión de Italia seguramente será vista como una débil excusa para repartirnos Italia.

English: The Papal Question
How should we deal with the Papal State in our union of Italy?
Spanish: ¿Cómo deberíamos lidiar con el Estado Papal en nuestra unificación de Italia?

English: Freedom or Subservience?

Should we establish our union of Italy as a truly independent state, or as a puppet to the Austrian crown? Granting them independence would help legitimize the actions we've taken so far, both in the eyes of the other greater powers and in the eyes of the Italian people.
Spanish: ¿Debemos establecer a Italia como un estado verdaderamente independiente, o como un títere de la corona austriaca? Concederles la independencia ayudaría a legitimar las acciones que hemos tomado hasta ahora, tanto a los ojos de las otras grandes potencias como a los del pueblo italiano.

English: Setting the Borders of Italy
With our Union of Italy at hand, how should we draw the border between Austria and Italy?
Spanish: Con la unificación de Italia a nuestro alcance, debemos decidir cómo será la frontera entre Austria e Italia.

English: Ask France to recognize Austrian claims?
We have been notified of France's intent to unify the Italian peninsula. Should we ask them to recognize our claims to the lands of Lombardy-Venice?
Spanish: Hemos sido notificados de la intención de Francia de unificar la península italiana. ¿Deberíamos pedirles que reconozcan nuestros reclamos a las tierras de Lombardía-Venecia?

English: Austrian Claims in Italy
Austria has expressed interest in our union of Italy. They ask for us to recognize their claim to Lombardy-Venice.
Spanish: Austria ha expresado su interés en nuestra unificación de Italia. Piden que reconozcamos su reclamo sobre Lombardía-Venecia.

English: Austrian Claims in Italy
France has recognized only our claims to Venice. They have dismissed our claim to Lombardia.
Spanish: Francia sólo ha reconocido nuestros reclamos por Venecia. Han desestimado nuestra reivindicación sobre Lombardía.

English: Austrian Claims in Italy
France has recognized our claim to Lombardy-Venice.
Spanish: Francia ha reconocido nuestro reclamo sobre Lombardía-Venecia.

English: South Italy
Cultural differences separate the southern half of the peninsula from the north. Should Italy be split along these lines? Two Sicilies might govern the region better.
Spanish: Las diferencias culturales separan el sur de la Península del norte. ¿Debería Italia dividirse según estas líneas? Las Dos Sicilias podrían gobernar mejor la región.

English: $FROMCOUNTRY$'s bid for independence

A diplomat from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us with a request to free $FROMCOUNTRY$ from their oppressive masters. We could attempt a coup that would install an independent government in $FROMCOUNTRY$, and $FROMCOUNTRY$ would gladly join us in our war.
Spanish: Un diplomático de $FROMCOUNTRY$ se ha dirigido a nosotros con una petición para liberar a $FROMCOUNTRY$ de sus amos opresores. Podríamos intentar un golpe de estado que instalara un gobierno independiente en $FROMCOUNTRY$, y $FROMCOUNTRY$ se uniría con gusto a nuestra guerra.

English: $FROMCOUNTRY$ accepts offer.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to our offer, we must now join them in their war.
Spanish: $FROMCOUNTRY$ ha accedido a nuestra oferta, ahora nos uniremos a su guerra.

English: $FROMCOUNTRY$ declines offer.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused our offer.
Spanish: $FROMCOUNTRY$ no ha accedido a nuestra oferta.

English: $FROMCOUNTRY$ has altered the deal.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted us under their protection. Unfortunately it seems we will still be a pawn to be shuffled between the greater powers.
Spanish: $FROMCOUNTRY$ nos ha aceptado bajo su protección. Desafortunadamente todo apunta a que aún seremos un peón explotado por las grandes potencias.

English: General Volkhovski's Landing

One of the first events of the restarted Caucasian War was General Volkhovski's landing in Circassia, near the modern town of Sochi. Originally plagued by setbacks due to Circassian resistance and poor organization, it was a good start and learning experience for the Russian armed forces.
Spanish: Uno de los primeros acontecimientos de la reiniciada Guerra del Cáucaso fue el desembarco del general Volkhovski en Circasia, cerca de la moderna ciudad de Sochi. Aunque en un principio estuvo plagado de contratiempos debido a la resistencia de los circasianos y a su mala organización, fue un buen comienzo y una experiencia de aprendizaje para las fuerzas armadas rusas.

English: Let the landing commence!
Let us bide our time.
Conflict at Tepsue

The Russians made a large landing at Tepsue soon after the Caucasian War restarted, intending to crush opposition in western Circassia after their successful occupation of eastern Circassia a decade earlier. Historically, the occupation was a reasonable success, yet casualties were very high on both sides and neither belligerent forgot the lessons learned during this conflict.
Spanish: Los Rusos hicieron un gran desembarco en Tepsue poco después de que se reiniciara la Guerra del Cáucaso, con la intención de aplastar a la oposición en el oeste de Circassia después de su exitosa ocupación del este de Circassia una década antes. Históricamente, la ocupación fue un éxito razonable, sin embargo, las bajas fueron muy altas en ambas partes y ninguno de los beligerantes olvidó las lecciones aprendidas durante este conflicto.

English: We will crush the Circassians!
We will do what is necessary and no more.
Spanish: No haremos más de lo necesario.

English: Colonel Obshevski Gives A Speech

Historically, soon after the conflict at Tepsue, Russian Colonel Obshevski gave a speech to the local Circassian population about the advantages of being under Russian control and the virtues of not rebelling against their Russian masters. The Circassians did not forget it, to the detriment of the Russians.
Spanish: Históricamente, poco después del conflicto de Tepsue, el coronel ruso Obshevski pronunció un discurso a la población circasiana local sobre las ventajas de estar bajo control ruso y las virtudes de no rebelarse contra sus amos rusos. Los circasianos no lo olvidaron, en detrimento de los rusos.

English: Let the Circassians know who is boss.
Spanish: Que los Circasianos se enteren quién manda.

English: Is this really necessary?
Imam Shamil Gains Power

Imam Shamil has gained power and become the Imam of the Caucasian Imamate! His frequent attacks against Russian outposts throughout the region are worrisome, and a decision is needed as to what to do with his resistance movement.
Spanish: ¡Imam Shamil ha ganado poder y se ha convertido en el Imam del Imamato caucásico! Sus frecuentes ataques contra avanzadas rusas en toda la región son preocupantes, y se necesita tomar una decisión sobre qué hacer con su movimiento de resistencia.

English: Let us fight back!
Attempt to pull out of our weaker outposts.
Spanish: Retiraros de nuestras avanzadas más débiles.

English: United Circassian Offensive

The Circassian resistance has managed to take out our minor outposts through sneak attacks, seizing supply depots, and what can be termed guerilla warfare. Although we have suffered much, our ready state of alertness prevented an overly large massacre of our people and has prevented our major outposts and fortresses from being overrun by the Circassians.
Spanish: La resistencia circasiana ha logrado eliminar nuestras avanzadas menores a través de ataques furtivos, la confiscación de depósitos de suministros y lo que se puede llamar guerra de guerrillas. Aunque hemos sufrido mucho, nuestro rápido estado de alerta impidió una masacre demasiado grande de nuestro pueblo y ha evitado que nuestros principales puestos avanzados y fortalezas sean invadidos por los Circasianos.

English: They will pay for this!
United Circassian Offensive

Although we attempted to pull out of our weaker outposts, the Circassians have ambushed our travelling forces and seized our supplies. Our larger outposts relied on these smaller reinforcements to properly defend, and we have suffered some losses in our major military and civilian centers. This perceived weakness has given the Circassians free reign to massacre our people, and has shamed us on a world scale.
Spanish: Aunque intentamos retirarnos de nuestros puestos avanzados más débiles, los Circasianos han emboscado a nuestras fuerzas itinerantes y se han apoderado de nuestros suministros. Nuestras avanzadas más grandes dependían de estos refuerzos más pequeños para defendernos adecuadamente, y hemos sufrido algunas pérdidas en nuestros principales centros militares y civiles. Esta debilidad percibida ha dado rienda suelta a los Circasianos para masacrar a nuestro pueblo, y nos ha avergonzado a escala mundial.

English: An unfortunate event, to be sure.
Imam Shamil Offers a Truce

Imam Shamil has stated his demands regarding the Caucasus: independence, a return to the status quo of 1834, or death! Historically, the Imam and the Tsar agreed to a peace treaty, which was respected for almost a decade, as it worked out to both sides' advantage. The Russians had been humiliated at the Caucasus, but the Circassians could not hold out much longer.
Spanish: Imam Shamil ha declarado sus demandas con respecto al Cáucaso: ¡Independencia, retorno al status quo de 1834 o muerte! Históricamente, el Imam y el zar acordaron un tratado de paz, que se respetó durante casi una década, ya que funcionó en beneficio de ambas partes. Los rusos habían sido humillados en el Cáucaso, pero los Circasianos no podían aguantar mucho más tiempo.

English: They will pay in time.
Let them go, we have failed in the Caucasus.
Spanish: Dejadlos ir, hemos fallado en el Cáucaso.

English: Unrest in the Caucasus
There is increased unrest as of late, as Imam Shamil has begin a campaign of peaceful resistance and invective, wanting independence for his people and the Caucasus.
Spanish: Últimamente ha habido un incremento en los disturbios, ya que Imam Shamil ha comenzado una campaña de resistencia pacífica e invectiva, queriendo la independencia de su pueblo y el Cáucaso.

English: This has gone on too long. Send in the troops!
Spanish: Esto ha ido demasiado lejos. Llamad a las tropas!

English: Organize our forces but do nothing.
Imam Shamil Stands Firm

Imam Shamil has released an ultimatum: Caucasian independence or indefinite rebellion. His troops have already seized Russian supply depots and a few outposts, and as such he has dishonourably broken our treaty.
Spanish: Imam Shamil ha publicado un ultimátum: independencia caucásica o rebelión infinita. Sus tropas ya se han apoderado de los depósitos de suministros rusos y de algunas avanzadas, y como tal ha roto deshonrosamente nuestro tratado.

English: We will not stand this insolence!
This is the last straw. Let them go.
Spanish: Este es el último intento. Dejadlos ir.

English: Victories in the Caucasus

A string of military and civil victories in the Caucasus has led to the breaking of most Circassian resistance! Imam Shamil is on the run and the back of the resistance is broken! It seems that the war that has raged for almost a hundred years is almost over.
A great day for Russians everywhere!
Spanish: ¡Un gran día para todos los Rusos!

English: Let the rebel scum suffer.
Ethnic Cleansing of the Caucasus

Historically, soon after major victories in the Caucasus, the Russians purged the area of any undesireable elements. The ethnic cleansing continued until the 1870s, as many natives of the area were killed or deported to the Ottoman Empire. Indeed, the ethnic cleansing of the area has been considered by many historians to be the first ethnic cleansing on a modern scale and the harbinger of genocides as a concept.
Spanish: Históricamente, poco después de grandes victorias en el Cáucaso, los rusos purgaron la zona de cualquier elemento indeseable. La limpieza étnica continuó hasta la década de 1870, ya que muchos nativos de la zona fueron asesinados o deportados al Imperio Otomano. De hecho, la limpieza étnica de la zona ha sido considerada por muchos historiadores como la primera limpieza étnica a escala moderna y el precusor de los genocidios como concepto.

English: We have fought for a hundred years. Let them suffer.
Spanish: Hemos luchado por cien años. Les tocará sufrir.

English: We need not descend into barbarism.
Imam Shamil Captured

Historically, Imam Shamil was captured in 1859. The Russians allowed him to live, albeit under surveillance in Kiev. The mutual respect that the Imam and the Tsar had for each other helped quite a bit in this aspect, and Imam Shamil saw the war as lost from this point. Although resistance continued in the Caucasus, the ideological center of the movement was removed, and the ideological foundation of the resistance foundered. Imam Shamil himself received permission from the Tsar to go on the Hajj to Mecca in 1869. He briefly stopped at Istanbul where he was greeted warmly by the Ottoman Sultan, but continued on his way to Mecca. He died shortly after completing the pilgrimage in 1871, a truly remarkable figure in life.
Spanish: Históricamente, Imam Shamil fue capturado en 1859. Los rusos le permitieron vivir, aunque bajo vigilancia en Kiev. El respeto mutuo que Imam y el Zar tenían el uno por el otro ayudó bastante en este aspecto, y Imam Shamil vio la guerra perdida desde este momento. Aunque la resistencia continuó en el Cáucaso, el centro ideológico del movimiento fue eliminado y el fundamento ideológico de la resistencia fracasó. El propio Imam Shamil recibió permiso del zar para ir en el Hayy a La Meca en 1869. Se detuvo brevemente en Estambul, donde fue recibido calurosamente por el sultán otomano, pero continuó su camino a La Meca. Murió poco después de completar la peregrinación en 1871, una figura realmente notable en vida.

English: Let him live free, but keep an eye on him.
Spanish: Dejadlo vivir libre, pero no lo perdáis de vista.

English: Let him suffer the fate of all traitors.
Spanish: Que sufra el destino digno de un traidor.

English: The End of the Caucasian War
Spanish: El fin de la Guerra del Cáucaso

English: The last pockets of resistance have foundered, the rebellion is leaderless, tens of thousands lie dead, and the Circassian/Caucasian War has finally ended after 100 years of bloodshed. The people of the Caucasus now know their place in the Russian Empire, but such wars are not that easy to forget.
Spanish: Los últimos focos de resistencia fueron sofocados, la rebelión no tiene líderes, decenas de miles yacen muertos y la guerra circasiana/caucásica finalmente ha terminado después de 100 años de derramamiento de sangre. El pueblo del Cáucaso ahora conoce su lugar en el Imperio Ruso, pero esas guerras no son tan fáciles de olvidar.

English: Victory is ours!
The Non-German Territories

Now that we have fulfilled our destiny and united the German people under one banner, the question of our non-German lands remains. There is cries for independence, or at the very least, increased autonomy from $COUNTRY$. Refusing will no doubt greatly upset the other great powers as well as our population. Many voices in Government say that granting our non-German territories independence or even just extended autonomy is the best course of action in order to minimise damage to our reputation on the world stage as well as satisfying our population.
Spanish: Ahora que hemos cumplido nuestro destino y unido al pueblo alemán bajo una sola bandera, la cuestión de nuestras tierras no alemanas permanece. Hay gritos de independencia o, al menos, una mayor autonomía de $COUNTRY$. Negarse sin duda molestará en gran medida a las grandes potencias, así como a nuestra población. Muchas voces en el Gobierno dicen que otorgar independencia a nuestros territorios no alemanes o incluso una autonomía extendida es el mejor curso de acción para minimizar el daño a nuestra reputación en el escenario mundial, así como para satisfacer a nuestra población.

The canal was practically finished, and it was to test the navigability that the Palatia was sent through. She touched bottom several times, but did not stick fast and sustained no damage. The New York Times, June 23, $YEAR$.

English: Today armed bedouins have started a revolt among our workers at the Suez Canal and construction was halted until further notice. We suspect the British are behind this, they opposed our project from the beginning accusing us of using slave labor. The true reason is ofcourse that the canal is a threat to their strategic interests. We have no other choice but to abolish Corvée (a form of unpaid labor) to resume the project. Unfortunately this affair will cost us dearly, both finacially and timewise.
French: Aujourd'hui'hui les bédouins armés ont commencé une révolte parmi nos ouvriers au Canal de Suez et la construction a été interrompue jusqu'à nouvel ordre. Nous soupçonnons que les Anglais sont derrière cela, ils se sont opposés à notre projet nous accusant depuis le début d'utiliser une main-d'œuvre d'esclave. La vraie raison est biensur que le canal est une menace à leurs intérêts stratégiques.Nous devons abolir la Corvée. Malheureusement cette affaire nous coûtera chère en temps et en argents

English: The Panama Canal joins the Atlantic Ocean and the Pacific Ocean replacing the long and treacherous route around South America. Construction was first started by the French but later abandoned due to technical problems, financial mismanagement and a high deathtoll of 22,000 thanks to tropical diseases. Construction was resumed by the USA who finished it in $YEAR$. Even with medical advances more than 5,000 workers died and total cost was over 600,000,000 dollars.

La construction a été commencé en 1880 par les Français, mais abandonné par la suite en raison de problèmes techniques, la mauvaise gestion financière et d'une mortalité élevé de 22.000 Merci aux maladies tropicales. En 1904, la construction fut reprise par les États-Unis qui l'a terminée en 1914. Même avec les progrès médicaux plus de 5.000 ouvriers sont morts et le coût total a été de plus 600 millions de dollars.

English: In order to build a canal across the Panama isthmus, we will need to come to an agreement with the nation that controls it.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us with a treaty to build a canal across the Panama isthmus. While this would have economic benefits for $COUNTRY$, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ negotiators have been incredibly aggressive-- and the terms they offer are almost insulting. If we agree, it will anger the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people and embarass our country. Is this the act of a close ally?

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ negotiators are outraged. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has refused our terms, fair though they were. Some have suggested this is hardly the act of an $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ally, and that $FROMCOUNTRY$ can no longer be trusted. They say we should aid the local rebels in the isthmus in setting up an independent government of their own, and that such a nation would be far more agreeable.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has dealt us a treacherous hand. Believing the Panamanians will be far more agreeable to their treaty, they have prompted the rebels to declare independence from $COUNTRY$ and actively prevented us from crushing them. Some believe we should give in and repair relations with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ while we can. Still others say we should fight!
Massacres of Badr Khan

Badr Khan Bey, A Hakkari Kurdish Amir, combined with other Kurdish forces led by Nurallah, attacked the Christian Assyrians, intending to burn, kill, destroy, and, if possible, exterminate the Assyrians race from the mountains.

Now that the war is over, the question arises whether or not we should allow the slaves we enlisted during the war to remain free, or send them back to work on the plantations. We made a promise to secure their freedom, but wars are a fickle thing, and some sacrifices have to be made for the betterment of the nation.

With the dawn of the twentieth century, slavery in modern countries is fading away due to the prevalence of industry. A mere thirty years ago $COUNTRY_ADJ$ strength may have been founded on the backs of our slaves, but as tractors, automobiles, trains and other machines are making industry replace old mass labour, we have to make a distinct choice. Do we organize our slave economy, favouring it over industrial strength, or do we join the onward march of progress and free ourselves from the shackles that a slave society has forced us into? Just as fifty years ago a great house was divided, so now our $COUNTRY$ must become all one thing, or all the other: strong in the grip of slavery, or strong in the freedom of progress.

The Confederate States of America are offering us our colony of Haiti, to be controlled by our government. This would allow us a stronger presence in the Caribbean and the New World as a whole, so should we accept this offer?

Without a leader, the Atlantic Slave Trade cannot continue. We have no choice but to end our trade, and focus on slavery within the bounds of our own country and neighbouring nations - or, should we have the power, we can lead the slave trade in place of the fools who dismantled it.

Once we may have made slavery the centrepiece of our country, but those times have passed. The time of mass labour and the slave trade is over, and we now sever all our attachments to those detestable pieces of our history.
The Apache Wars

In order to expand $COUNTRY_ADJ$ hegemony in the former Native American provinces, there has to be some amount of integration or assimilation. One group of tribes has taken to this suggestion violently, and have begun organizing an uprising.
Let them charge against Dixie steel!
The leader of the Apache rebels, Geronimo, has been imprisoned and the spirit of his people has been broken. Now, nothing prevents us from settling these lands we have claimed.
In 1854, Elisha Otis demonstrated the first passenger-carrying elevator, an invention which would prove invaluable in the construction of modern, multi-storey buildings.

Legendary showman (and scam artist) P.T. Barnum opened his first three-ring circus in 1871, beginning a circus craze that would last well into the 20th century. Of course, most of the excitement and the curios he displayed were all fake, but that was all part of the show - and the money.

In order to improve the efficiency of railroads in our nation, we have adopted a system of standard time to prevent any confusion between train stations on the length of our railroad networks. We will name the centre of these time-zones "Confederate Standard Time", and we believe that this idea will be well-liked by similarly minded countries.

Pioneered by men like Scott Joplin and Ernest Hogan, ragtime is a genre of music that began amongst African-Americans in the South. Afterwards, it became widely known and widely played on piano, and had a key role in popularizing new music recording methods and the later genre of jazz.

Blues music, like ragtime and jazz before it, was first played and composed by Afro-American musicians of the American South. While jazz enjoyed popularity amongst blacks and whites in the 1920s and 1930s, blues was mostly relegated to black listeners until after the Second World War. It was arguably formed as a musical genre in 1912 with the publishing of Hart Wand's "Dallas Blues", but has its roots in traditional slave songs of the 19th century. Most famously, blues later became the bedrock for the most popular musical sensation of them all: rock n' roll.

Though the North always was the industrial centre of America, in the Deep South there was the city of New Orleans, always full of sound and lights. The epitome of southern prosperity, New Orleans was a hub of trade and immigration, and at its peak was the third largest city in the entire United States.

The city of New Orleans always has had an association with the festival of Mardi Gras, a Christian cultural celebration taking place prior to the season of Lent brought to the area by French Catholic colonists. Normally it is meant to be just a single day of celebrations, but in New Orleans the colourful and energetic Mardi Gras can last for several days more. Mardi Gras was recognized as an official state holiday of Louisiana in 1875.

Politeness, etiquette, and the warm comforts of home: these define the ideal of Southern hospitality, and is a major characterizing point of our nation. People are expected to respect their neighbours and use polite terms even when addressing strangers. Some feel that this is an act put on to cover up Southern flaws such as slavery and widespread poverty, but its nature can be traced back to the traditional Christian moral influence on the Southern states before secession. Regardless, it's made a good mark on our country, and we're proud of it.

Founded in 1871, the National Rifle Association was originally a set of shooting clubs organized to improve the marksmanship of American soldiers. After the Civil War, it was noted that few shots fired actually hit their targets, so improved drill was in order. These shooting clubs improved skill with firearms, and contributed to the military as a whole moving away from the classic style of rank and file warfare, which put focus on volume of fire rather than accuracy. Within a few decades, firearms and marksmanship became a proud part of the country's culture.

An infestation of boll weevils has struck our cotton crops in $PROVINCENAME$! Farmers are fearing that our supply of cotton won't last with this insect terrorizing our provinces, and many are suggesting that we abandon cotton to focus on different trade goods. Should we follow their advice, or try to recover the cotton?

Rising up from the south, the boll weevil is a dreadful little insect that seems to have little interest in anything but planting its eggs in cotton flowers and buds. Regardless of its origins, it poses a major threat to our cotton industry, and must be stopped at all costs. For the time being, though, we fear that there may be no direct way of containing the insect, not on a large scale.

One hundred years ago, the Thirteen Colonies organized and succeeded in their rebellion against their British colonial oppressors, forming the United States of America on the 4th of July, 1776. We have seen this country through fire and water, but by God, we will never let America fall. Now unto the end of time, the United States will be a shining name in the pages of history, a beacon of freedom and democracy in the world. Today of all days, we truly should be proud.

Travelling along the western trails into California, a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ wagon group known as the Donner party has been discovered... or, at least, what is left of it. The people of the Donner party were stranded in the wilderness for so long that their minds were lost, and they succumbed to cannibalism and other savage acts. With the revelation of this news, the world can now see the mortifying reality of life in Western America.

Due to recent heavy rainfall and the negligence of a local construction company, a dam on the Little Conemaugh River has burst, flooding and decimating Johnstown, Pennsylvania. The cleanup costs will be higher than any disaster we've seen before, and more importantly, the people will soon be looking for someone to place the blame upon. The government could step in and take care of everything in place of the local industrialists and clubs that may have caused the flood, or we can require that the groups pay from their own pockets to fix their mistake.

Though our war with the Confederate States is far from over, it isn't going either poorly or well. However, that doesn't stop the war from being a contentious issue, and in New York most notably the people have staged an uprising against the local government, demanding that the strict conscription practices in place for the war be rescinded. We're in the middle of a war, so we have to choose some way to deal with them, without sacrificing our draft. The question is, are these riots worth putting down, or are our other concerns far greater?

James Madison, fourth president of the United States of America and the man titled "The Father of the Constitution", was a key figure in the founding of our nation. On June 28th, 1836, he passed away - much to the chagrin of those close to him, who wished for him to follow the "tradition" of Thomas Jefferson and John Adams, who both died on Independence Day.

The Gulf of Mexico is no stranger to extreme wind and rain, but in 1900, a certain hurricane blew away any old records. The storm decimated Galveston, Texas, and reached the Canadian Maritimes before dissipating completely. In cost of lives and money, few other disasters can compare, and this is an especially heavy blow for the coastal areas of the Gulf and Texas.

A man going by the name of Doctor Howard Henry Holmes has been apprehended and executed after murdering up to two-hundred people after the last $COUNTRY_ADJ$ World's Fair. According to police reports, he built up a so-called "Murder Castle" in $CAPITAL$, killing primarily young women that he lured to his lair. Using legitimate medical contacts he was able to dispose of the bodies, and for a long time he remained far out of suspicion. Only after leaving the city due to economic troubles did Holmes end up being captured, as a result of alleged horse theft. Afterwards the truth of his grisly crimes came to light, and he was sentenced to death.

Along the Missouri River and the Upper Mississippi, heavy rainfall and inadequate preparation have led to major floods, the worst in decades. With the increasing population of $COUNTRY$ especially in the areas around the Mississippi and its tributaries, it is becoming increasingly important to develop a set of levees and ditches to prevent high water from wiping out whole towns.

Not long after last decade's horrendous floods along the Upper Mississippi, there has been another year of rain and subsequent floods along the very same Mississippi River. We had prepared and made sure riverside towns were prepared for any threat of flooding, but this time the floods hit mostly rural and new colonial towns, which hadn't yet managed to create systems of levees to cope with rising water levels.

The worst floods yet have hit many of our cities, no matter how high we built the levees nor how low and long we dug the ditches. New Orleans, shining gem of Louisiana, has been dealt a heavy blow, along with cities and regions all along the mighty Mississippi River. Even modern technology could not save us, and so we can only pray that something of this scale never happens again to our country.
Our country is now a slave state of $FROMCOUNTRY$, and our government now functions solely to operate the mechanisms of the vile slave trade. There is no freedom left in $COUNTRY$.
Liberty has been stolen from our country.
A New Menace
We are not faced with the lesser of two weevils, that is for sure.
Spanish: No nos enfrentaremos al menor de dos gorgojos, eso seguro.
